comments.body: is this the only case where it needs/should be preserved? (e.g. what about other how's)

in `pandas/src/join.pyx` only `left_outer_join` accepts this extra argument [`sort`](https://github.com/pydata/pandas/blob/2ad9dc79b33a3510d89d446a7c82200a753e132c/pandas/src/join.pyx#L52), which was added in [this](https://github.com/pydata/pandas/commit/21308b2ff75c7c94cb06666394d8e9e80eb6389d) commit to preserve left frame order.

I think it makes sense, because except for the case of left join preserving order is not well defined or I do not see an immediate use for it.

comments.body: your categories are `0,1,2` (with 0 being both) as you are filling above. so why the `[1,2,3]`
The categories map onto the values of 1,2,3 (with 3 being both).
what is the fillna for then?

The flow is:
    - Add a column to each input data frame. To left, make column all `1`s. To right, make column all `2`s. 
    - After merge, fill missing to zeros, then sum the two columns. (Otherwise we'd have lots of `1` + np.nan if an observation was only in `left`.)
    - if only in `left`, sum is 1. If only in `right`, sum is `2`. If in both, sum is `3`.
